intro: Tetralobus, commonly known as the four-lobed plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive four-lobed leaves, which give it its name. The flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, often with five petals. Tetralobus species are found in various regions, primarily in tropical and subtropical areas. These plants are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique foliage.
